column3: the "Irrashai" greeting serves several purposes. First
column4: it can unify the front of house and help maintain focus when things are hectic. Secondly
column5: it helps the back of house know how many customers are coming through at any given moment and helps them prepare for what is likely to be an onslaught of orders. And lastly
column6: the greeting is an element that not only preserves our company's origins
column7: but also introduces an aspect of Japanese culture that's not commonly found here in Houston -- in short
column8: it's a talking point for us. All that said
column10: I do understand your frustration. But as a franchisee
column11: we are beholden to specific protocols such as this.
